Go search on <a href="http://google.com">http://google.com</a>!

link should be url decoded: <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mase_%28disambiguation%29">http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mase_(disambiguation)</a>

Brackets in url and backslashes in links:

About port info on wiki: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Port_(computer_networking) port]

About port info on wiki: [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Port_(computer_networking) port]

[https://www.google.com I'm an inline-style link]

[https://www.google.com I'm an inline-style link with title]
and another one in the same paragraph:
[https://www.google.com I'm an inline-style link with title]

[[../blob/(master)/LICENSE|I'm a relative reference to a repository file]]

Or leave it empty and use the [[|link text itself]]

A [http://example.com link [in a link](http://example.com)]
